content: As an advanced reading comprehension assistant, your task is to analyze text passages and corresponding questions meticulously. Your response start after "Thought: ", where you will methodically break down the reasoning process, illustrating how you arrive at conclusions. Conclude with "Answer: " to present a concise, definitive response, devoid of additional elaborations, and keep the same writing style as the found source text if the question is a open-ended question else you can answer just Yes or No.

What are the skills learning outcomes for the Data Structures and Algorithms course? 
Answer: analyzing algorithms, generalize data, and algorithm settings.

Wikipedia Title: Course ID: MTH00010
Analysis 1A is a Compulsory course (ID: MTH00010) available in the odd semester. It is led by Ong Thanh Hai. Prerequisites: none. The course aims to deliver the following outcomes: The objective of the module is to equip students with the basic knowledge of the foundation of calculus as the foundation for specialized modules.. Main content: The course covers the basics of real numbers, sequences and series of real numbers..

Wikipedia Title: Course ID: MTH10401
Course Measure Theory and Probability (ID: MTH10401) falls under the Compulsory category and is scheduled for the odd semester. The instructor is Dang Duc Trong. Note: It requires prior completion of Analysis 1A. Learning outcomes expected: The objective of the module is to equip students with the basic knowledge of the foundation of measure theory and the theory of integral, and the application of the measure theory in probability theory.. The course discusses: Elementary probability theory, abstract measure theory.
Integration with respect to probability measures, expectation, and variance
Random variables, Law of large numbers and limit theorems.
Changes of measures and the Radon-Nikodym Theorem.
Conditional expectations, filtrations, and martingales..

Wikipedia Title: Course ID: MTH10315
In the even semester, students can take Analysis and Design of Information Systems (code: MTH10315). It is taught by Nguyen Hien Luong, categorized as a Compulsory course. It requires prior completion of Introduction To Database Systems, Object Oriented Programming. Learning outcomes include: Introduce students to classical design and analysis methods used in functional analysis, data analysis, dynamic analysis, and systems design.. Topics covered in this course are: Method of surveying the current situation and understanding the needs.
Structured analysis (SA).
Linked entity data model, relational data model.
SART method.
SD method..

Wikipedia Title: Course ID: MTH00011
Course Calculus 1A (ID: MTH00011) falls under the Compulsory category and is scheduled for the odd semester. The instructor is Nguyen Vu Huy. Note: There are no prerequisites for this course. Learning outcomes expected: The objective of the module is to equip students with the basic knowledge of calculus as the foundation for specialized modules.. The course discusses: The course covers the basics of continuity, limit, derivative, Riemann integral..

Wikipedia Title: Course ID: MTH10358
Course Data Mining (ID: MTH10358) falls under the Compulsory category and is scheduled for the even semester. The instructor is Nguyen Thanh Binh. Note: It requires prior completion of Fundamentals of Computer Programming. Learning outcomes expected: After successfully completing this course, students will be able to:
Analyze data and carry out the steps of the data mining process
Understand and apply data mining algorithms and tools that can be used to assist data analysts and data mining application developers
Explain common data mining tasks such as regression, classification, clustering, and association rule mining
Participate in advanced research to improve existing algorithms for each specific problem in data mining.. The course discusses: This course is intended to introduce the knowledge mining process, concepts, technologies, and applications of data mining. In addition, this course also covers data preprocessing problems, data mining tasks, algorithms, and data mining tools that can be used to assist data analysts and analysts. Data mining application development. Subject-specific topics including overview of data mining, data mining problems, data preprocessing problems, data regression, data classification, clustering data mining, association rule mining, data mining application development, and advanced research topics in data mining..
